title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement codeofconduct@posit.co. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to osrm.backend
text: outlines propose change osrm.backend. detailed discussion contributing tidyverse packages, please see development contributing guide code review principles.

title: Contributing to osrm.backend
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to osrm.backend
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed). See guide create great issue advice.

title: Contributing to osrm.backend
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("e-kotov/osrm.backend", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to osrm.backend
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to osrm.backend
text: Please note osrm.backend project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: Getting help with osrm.backend
text: Thanks using osrm.backend! filing issue, places explore pieces put together make process smooth possible.

title: Getting help with osrm.backend
text: Start making minimal reproducible example using reprex package. haven’t heard used reprex , ’re treat! Seriously, reprex make R-question-asking endeavors easier (pretty incredible ROI five ten minutes ’ll take learn ’s ). additional reprex pointers, check Get help! section tidyverse site.

title: Getting help with osrm.backend
text: Armed reprex, next step figure ask. ’s question: start community.rstudio.com, /StackOverflow. people answer questions. ’s bug: ’re right place, file issue. ’re sure: let community help figure ! problem bug feature request, can easily return report . opening new issue, sure search issues pull requests make sure bug hasn’t reported /already fixed development version. default, search pre-populated :issue :open. can edit qualifiers (e.g. :pr, :closed) needed. example, ’d simply remove :open search issues repo, open closed.

title: Getting help with osrm.backend
text: efficient possible, development tidyverse packages tends bursty, shouldn’t worry don’t get immediate response. Typically don’t look repo sufficient quantity issues accumulates, ’s burst intense activity focus efforts. makes development efficient avoids expensive context switching problems, cost taking longer get back . process makes good reprex particularly important might multiple months initial report start working . can’t reproduce bug, can’t fix !

title: Authors and Citation
text: Egor Kotov. Author, maintainer, copyright holder.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Kotov E (2025). osrm.backend: Install control OSRM backend. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://github.com/e-kotov/osrm.backend.
code: @Manual{,   title = {osrm.backend: Install and control OSRM backend},   author = {Egor Kotov},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://github.com/e-kotov/osrm.backend}, }

title: Install and control OSRM backend
text: goal osrm.backend companion osrm R package https://github.com/riatelab/osrm: easily install osrm.backend major operating systems (Linux, Windows, MacOS); provide wrapper functions prepare data osrm routing; provide wrapper start/stop local OSRM backend server.

what: Check for Available OSRM Versions — osrm_check_available_versions
title: Check for Available OSRM Versions — osrm_check_available_versions
text: Queries GitHub API get list available version tags OSRM backend binaries current platform.

title: Check for Available OSRM Versions — osrm_check_available_versions
code: osrm_check_available_versions(prereleases = FALSE)

title: Check for Available OSRM Versions — osrm_check_available_versions
text: prereleases logical value. TRUE, include pre-release versions returned list. Defaults FALSE.

title: Check for Available OSRM Versions — osrm_check_available_versions
text: character vector available version tags.

title: Check for Available OSRM Versions — osrm_check_available_versions
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get all stable versions with binaries for this platform stable_versions <- osrm_check_available_versions() head(stable_versions)  # Get all versions, including pre-releases, with binaries all_versions <- osrm_check_available_versions(prereleases = TRUE) head(all_versions) } # }

what: Check for the Latest Stable OSRM Version — osrm_check_latest_version
title: Check for the Latest Stable OSRM Version — osrm_check_latest_version
text: Queries GitHub API find recent stable (non-pre-release) version tag OSRM backend binaries available current platform.

title: Check for the Latest Stable OSRM Version — osrm_check_latest_version
code: osrm_check_latest_version()

title: Check for the Latest Stable OSRM Version — osrm_check_latest_version
text: string containing latest version tag (e.g., "v5.27.1").

title: Check for the Latest Stable OSRM Version — osrm_check_latest_version
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ latest_v <- osrm_check_latest_version() print(latest_v) } # }

what: Clear OSRM Path from Project's .Rprofile — osrm_clear_path
title: Clear OSRM Path from Project's .Rprofile — osrm_clear_path
text: Scans .Rprofile file current project's root directory removes lines added osrm_install() modify PATH.

title: Clear OSRM Path from Project's .Rprofile — osrm_clear_path
code: osrm_clear_path(quiet = FALSE)

title: Clear OSRM Path from Project's .Rprofile — osrm_clear_path
text: quiet logical value. TRUE, suppresses messages. Defaults FALSE.

title: Clear OSRM Path from Project's .Rprofile — osrm_clear_path
text: Invisibly returns TRUE file modified, FALSE otherwise.

title: Clear OSRM Path from Project's .Rprofile — osrm_clear_path
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Clean up the project's .Rprofile osrm_clear_path() } # }

what: Contract OSRM Graph for Contraction Hierarchies (CH) — osrm_contract
title: Contract OSRM Graph for Contraction Hierarchies (CH) — osrm_contract
text: Run osrm-contract tool contract OSRM graph CH pipeline. running, companion <base>.osrm.hsgr file must exist confirm success.

title: Contract OSRM Graph for Contraction Hierarchies (CH) — osrm_contract
code: osrm_contract(   input_osrm,   threads = 8L,   verbosity = c("INFO", "NONE", "ERROR", "WARNING", "DEBUG"),   segment_speed_file = NULL,   turn_penalty_file = NULL,   edge_weight_updates_over_factor = 0,   parse_conditionals_from_now = 0,   time_zone_file = NULL,   echo_cmd = FALSE,   echo = TRUE,   spinner = TRUE )

title: Contract OSRM Graph for Contraction Hierarchies (CH) — osrm_contract
text: input_osrm string. Base path .osrm files (without extension). threads integer. Number threads use; default 8. verbosity string. Log verbosity level passed -l/--verbosity (one "NONE","ERROR","WARNING","INFO","DEBUG"); default "INFO". segment_speed_file string NULL. Path nodeA,nodeB,speed CSV; default NULL. turn_penalty_file string NULL. Path from_,to_,via_nodes,penalties CSV; default NULL. edge_weight_updates_over_factor numeric. Threshold logging large weight updates; default 0. parse_conditionals_from_now numeric. UTC timestamp conditional restrictions; default 0. time_zone_file string NULL. GeoJSON file time zone boundaries; default NULL. echo_cmd logical. Print command running; default FALSE. echo logical. Stream stdout/stderr; default TRUE. spinner logical. Show spinner instead live logs; default TRUE.

title: Contract OSRM Graph for Contraction Hierarchies (CH) — osrm_contract
text: list elements: osrm_path normalized path input .osrm base (invisibly). can passed osrm_start_server(). logs processx::run result object.

what: Customize OSRM Graph for Multi-Level Dijkstra (MLD) — osrm_customize
title: Customize OSRM Graph for Multi-Level Dijkstra (MLD) — osrm_customize
text: Run osrm-customize tool customize partitioned OSRM graph MLD pipeline. running, companion <base>.osrm.mldgr file must exist confirm success.

title: Customize OSRM Graph for Multi-Level Dijkstra (MLD) — osrm_customize
code: osrm_customize(   input_osrm,   threads = 8L,   verbosity = c("INFO", "NONE", "ERROR", "WARNING", "DEBUG"),   segment_speed_file = NULL,   turn_penalty_file = NULL,   edge_weight_updates_over_factor = 0,   parse_conditionals_from_now = 0,   time_zone_file = NULL,   echo_cmd = FALSE,   echo = TRUE,   spinner = TRUE )

title: Customize OSRM Graph for Multi-Level Dijkstra (MLD) — osrm_customize
text: input_osrm string. Base path partitioned .osrm files (without extension). threads integer. Number threads use; default 8 (osrm-customize's default). verbosity string. Log verbosity level passed -l/--verbosity (one "NONE","ERROR","WARNING","INFO","DEBUG"); default "INFO". segment_speed_file string NULL. Path nodeA,nodeB,speed CSV; default NULL. turn_penalty_file string NULL. Path from_,to_,via_nodes,penalties CSV; default NULL. edge_weight_updates_over_factor numeric. Factor threshold logging large weight updates; default 0. parse_conditionals_from_now numeric. UTC timestamp evaluate conditional turn restrictions; default 0. time_zone_file string NULL. GeoJSON file time zone boundaries; default NULL. echo_cmd logical. Print command running; default FALSE. echo logical. Stream stdout/stderr; default TRUE. spinner logical. Show spinner instead live logs; default TRUE.

title: Customize OSRM Graph for Multi-Level Dijkstra (MLD) — osrm_customize
text: list elements: osrm_path normalized path input .osrm base (invisibly). can passed osrm_start_server(). logs processx::run result object.

what: Extract OSM into OSRM Graph Files — osrm_extract
title: Extract OSM into OSRM Graph Files — osrm_extract
text: Run osrm-extract tool preprocess OSM file (.osm, .osm.bz2, .osm.pbf) base .osrm graph files using specified Lua profile.  running, companion <base>.osrm.timestamp file must exist confirm success.

title: Extract OSM into OSRM Graph Files — osrm_extract
code: osrm_extract(   input_osm,   profile = osrm_find_profile("car.lua"),   threads = 8L,   overwrite = FALSE,   verbosity = c("INFO", "NONE", "ERROR", "WARNING", "DEBUG"),   data_version = NULL,   small_component_size = 1000L,   with_osm_metadata = FALSE,   parse_conditional_restrictions = FALSE,   location_dependent_data = NULL,   disable_location_cache = FALSE,   dump_nbg_graph = FALSE,   echo_cmd = FALSE,   echo = TRUE,   spinner = TRUE )

title: Extract OSM into OSRM Graph Files — osrm_extract
text: input_osm string. Path input OSM file: .osm, .osm.bz2, .osm.pbf. profile string. Path OSRM Lua profile (e.g. returned osrm_find_profile("car.lua")). threads integer. Number threads -t/--threads; default 8 (OSRM's default). overwrite logical. FALSE (default), stops existing .osrm* files matching base name found alongside input_osm. Set TRUE proceed regardless. verbosity string. Log verbosity level passed -l/--verbosity (one "NONE","ERROR","WARNING","INFO","DEBUG"), default "INFO". data_version string NULL. Passed -d/--data_version; default NULL, case option omitted. small_component_size integer. --small-component-size; default 1000 (OSRM's default). with_osm_metadata logical. TRUE, adds ---osm-metadata; default FALSE. parse_conditional_restrictions logical. TRUE, adds --parse-conditional-restrictions; default FALSE. location_dependent_data string NULL. Path GeoJSON, passed --location-dependent-data; default NULL, case option omitted. disable_location_cache logical. TRUE, adds --disable-location-cache; default FALSE. dump_nbg_graph logical. TRUE, adds --dump-nbg-graph; default FALSE. echo_cmd logical. Print command running; default FALSE. echo logical. Stream stdout/stderr; default TRUE. spinner logical. Show spinner instead live logs; default TRUE.

title: Extract OSM into OSRM Graph Files — osrm_extract
text: list two elements: osrm_path expected path generated .osrm base, .e. timestamp file path .timestamp dropped. logs processx::run result object.

title: Extract OSM into OSRM Graph Files — osrm_extract

what: Locate an OSRM Lua profile (e.g. car.lua) in a host installation — osrm_find_profile
title: Locate an OSRM Lua profile (e.g. car.lua) in a host installation — osrm_find_profile
text: default OSRM ships profiles "car", "bike" "foot" profiles/ directory alongside binaries.  function try locate osrm-routed PATH, resolve symlinks, look first profiles/ directory next binary (placed osrm_install()). fails, looks sibling directories share/osrm/profiles share/osrm-backend/profiles. fails, try fall back /usr/local/share/osrm/profiles,/usr/local/share/osrm-backend/profiles, /usr/share/osrm/profiles, /usr/share/osrm-backend/profiles.

title: Locate an OSRM Lua profile (e.g. car.lua) in a host installation — osrm_find_profile
code: osrm_find_profile(profile = "car.lua")

title: Locate an OSRM Lua profile (e.g. car.lua) in a host installation — osrm_find_profile
text: profile single string, name Lua profile file (e.g. "car.lua"). Defaults "car.lua".

title: Locate an OSRM Lua profile (e.g. car.lua) in a host installation — osrm_find_profile
text: normalized filesystem path profile.

title: Locate an OSRM Lua profile (e.g. car.lua) in a host installation — osrm_find_profile
code: # \donttest{ osrm_find_profile("car.lua") #> [1] "/home/runner/.cache/R/osrm.backend/profiles/car.lua" # }

title: Install OSRM Backend Binaries — osrm_install
text: Downloads installs pre-compiled binaries OSRM backend official GitHub releases. function automatically detects user's operating system architecture download appropriate files. latest v5 release (v5.27.1) v6.0.0 manually tested known work well; releases available GitHub can installed guranteed function correctly.

title: Install OSRM Backend Binaries — osrm_install
code: osrm_install(   version = "v5.27.1",   dest_dir = NULL,   force = FALSE,   path_action = c("session", "project", "none"),   quiet = FALSE )

title: Install OSRM Backend Binaries — osrm_install
text: version string specifying OSRM version tag install. Defaults "v5.27.1". Use "latest" automatically find recent stable version calling osrm_check_latest_version(). Versions v5.27.1 v6.0.0 trigger warning still attempted binaries available. dest_dir string specifying directory OSRM binaries installed. NULL (default), user-friendly, persistent location chosen via tools::R_user_dir("osrm.backend", = "cache"). force logical value. TRUE, reinstall OSRM even already found dest_dir. FALSE (default), function stop existing installation detected. path_action string specifying handle system PATH. One : "session" (default): Adds OSRM bin directory PATH current R session . "project": Modifies .Rprofile current project set PATH future sessions project. "none": modify PATH. quiet logical value. TRUE, suppresses confirmation prompt path_action = "project". Defaults FALSE.

title: Install OSRM Backend Binaries — osrm_install
text: path installation directory, invisibly.

title: Install OSRM Backend Binaries — osrm_install
text: function performs following steps: Queries GitHub API find specified release Project-OSRM/osrm-backend. Identifies correct binary (.tar.gz archive) user's OS (Linux, macOS, Windows) architecture (x64, arm64). Downloads archive temporary location. Extracts archive locates OSRM executables (e.g., osrm-routed, osrm-extract). Copies executables local directory (defaults tools::R_user_dir("osrm.backend", = "cache")). Downloads matching Lua profiles release tarball installs alongside binaries. Optionally modifies PATH environment variable current session project. Power users (including package authors running cross-platform tests) can override auto-detected platform setting R options osrm.backend.override_os osrm.backend.override_arch (e.g., options(osrm.backend.override_os = "linux", osrm.backend.override_arch = "arm64")) calling osrm_install(). Overrides allow requesting binaries OS CPU combination exists GitHub releases.

title: Install OSRM Backend Binaries — osrm_install
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Install the default stable version and set PATH for this session osrm_install()  # Install for a project non-interactively (e.g., in a script) osrm_install(path_action = "project", quiet = TRUE)  # Clean up the project's .Rprofile osrm_clear_path() } # }

what: Partition OSRM Graph for Multi-Level Dijkstra (MLD) — osrm_partition
title: Partition OSRM Graph for Multi-Level Dijkstra (MLD) — osrm_partition
text: Run osrm-partition tool partition OSRM graph MLD pipeline. running, companion <base>.osrm.partition file must exist confirm success.

title: Partition OSRM Graph for Multi-Level Dijkstra (MLD) — osrm_partition
code: osrm_partition(   input_osrm,   threads = 8L,   verbosity = c("INFO", "NONE", "ERROR", "WARNING", "DEBUG"),   balance = 1.2,   boundary = 0.25,   optimizing_cuts = 10L,   small_component_size = 1000L,   max_cell_sizes = c(128, 4096, 65536, 2097152),   echo_cmd = FALSE,   echo = TRUE,   spinner = TRUE )

title: Partition OSRM Graph for Multi-Level Dijkstra (MLD) — osrm_partition
text: input_osrm string. Base path .osrm files (without extension). threads integer. Number threads use; default 8 (osrm-partition's default). verbosity string. Log verbosity level passed -l/--verbosity (one "NONE","ERROR","WARNING","INFO","DEBUG"); default "INFO". balance numeric. Balance left right side single bisection; default 1.2. boundary numeric. Percentage embedded nodes contract sources sinks; default 0.25. optimizing_cuts integer. Number cuts use optimizing single bisection; default 10. small_component_size integer. Size threshold small components; default 1000. max_cell_sizes numeric vector. Maximum cell sizes starting level 1; default c(128,4096,65536,2097152). echo_cmd logical. Print command running; default FALSE. echo logical. Stream stdout/stderr; default TRUE. spinner logical. Show spinner instead live logs; default TRUE.

title: Partition OSRM Graph for Multi-Level Dijkstra (MLD) — osrm_partition
text: list elements: osrm_path normalized path input .osrm base (invisibly). logs processx::run result object.

what: Prepare OSRM Graph for Routing (Extract + Partition/Contract) — osrm_prepare_graph
title: Prepare OSRM Graph for Routing (Extract + Partition/Contract) — osrm_prepare_graph
text: High-level wrapper first runs osrm-extract OSM file produce base .osrm graph, prepares routing via either MLD pipeline (osrm-partition + osrm-customize) CH pipeline (osrm-contract).

title: Prepare OSRM Graph for Routing (Extract + Partition/Contract) — osrm_prepare_graph
code: osrm_prepare_graph(   input_osm,   profile = osrm_find_profile("car.lua"),   threads = 8L,   overwrite = FALSE,   verbosity = c("INFO", "NONE", "ERROR", "WARNING", "DEBUG"),   data_version = NULL,   small_component_size = 1000L,   with_osm_metadata = FALSE,   parse_conditional_restrictions = FALSE,   location_dependent_data = NULL,   disable_location_cache = FALSE,   dump_nbg_graph = FALSE,   algorithm = c("mld", "ch"),   balance = 1.2,   boundary = 0.25,   optimizing_cuts = 10L,   max_cell_sizes = c(128, 4096, 65536, 2097152),   echo_cmd = FALSE,   echo = TRUE,   spinner = TRUE )

title: Prepare OSRM Graph for Routing (Extract + Partition/Contract) — osrm_prepare_graph
text: input_osm string. Path input OSM file: .osm, .osm.bz2, .osm.pbf. profile string. Path OSRM Lua profile (e.g. returned osrm_find_profile("car.lua")). threads integer. Number threads extract partition/contract; default 8. overwrite logical. FALSE, stops existing .osrm* files matching base name found alongside input_osm. Set TRUE overwrite . verbosity string. Log verbosity extract/partition/contract (one "NONE","ERROR","WARNING","INFO","DEBUG"); default "INFO". data_version string NULL. Passed osrm-extract via -d; default NULL. small_component_size integer. extract & partition; default 1000. with_osm_metadata logical. Adds ---osm-metadata extract; default FALSE. parse_conditional_restrictions logical. Adds --parse-conditional-restrictions; default FALSE. location_dependent_data string NULL. Path GeoJSON extract; default NULL. disable_location_cache logical. Adds --disable-location-cache; default FALSE. dump_nbg_graph logical. Adds --dump-nbg-graph; default FALSE. algorithm string. One "mld" (default) "ch". balance numeric. Balance osrm-partition; default 1.2. boundary numeric. Boundary percentage osrm-partition; default 0.25. optimizing_cuts integer. Optimizing cuts osrm-partition; default 10. max_cell_sizes numeric vector. Max cell sizes osrm-partition; default c(128,4096,65536,2097152). echo_cmd logical. Print command running; default FALSE. echo logical. Stream stdout/stderr; default TRUE. spinner logical. Show spinner instead live logs; default TRUE.

title: Prepare OSRM Graph for Routing (Extract + Partition/Contract) — osrm_prepare_graph
text: list elements: osrm_path normalized path final .osrm base. can passed osrm_start_server(). logs list processx::run results stage: extract, partition/contract, customize (MLD).

what: Start an OSRM MLD/CH server with osrm-routed — osrm_start_server
title: Start an OSRM MLD/CH server with osrm-routed — osrm_start_server
text: Launches osrm-routed process pointing localized OSRM graph (either .osrm.mldgr MLD .osrm.hsgr CH/CoreCH).

title: Start an OSRM MLD/CH server with osrm-routed — osrm_start_server
code: osrm_start_server(   osrm_path,   version = FALSE,   help = FALSE,   verbosity = c("INFO", "ERROR", "WARNING", "NONE", "DEBUG"),   trial = FALSE,   ip = "0.0.0.0",   port = 5001L,   threads = 8L,   shared_memory = FALSE,   memory_file = NULL,   mmap = FALSE,   dataset_name = NULL,   algorithm = NULL,   max_viaroute_size = 500L,   max_trip_size = 100L,   max_table_size = 100L,   max_matching_size = 100L,   max_nearest_size = 100L,   max_alternatives = 3L,   max_matching_radius = -1L,   echo_cmd = FALSE )

title: Start an OSRM MLD/CH server with osrm-routed — osrm_start_server
text: osrm_path Character(1). Path .osrm.mldgr .osrm.hsgr file version Logical; TRUE, prints version exits help Logical; TRUE, prints help exits verbosity Character; one "NONE","ERROR","WARNING","INFO","DEBUG" trial Logical integer; TRUE >0, quits initialization (default: FALSE) ip Character; IP address bind (default: "0.0.0.0") port Integer; TCP port listen (default: 5000) threads Integer; number worker threads (default: 8) shared_memory Logical; load graph shared memory (default: FALSE) memory_file Character NULL; DEPRECATED (behaves like mmap) mmap Logical; memory-map data files (default: FALSE) dataset_name Character NULL; name shared memory dataset algorithm Character NULL; one "CH","CoreCH","MLD". NULL (default), auto-selected based file extension max_viaroute_size Integer (default: 500) max_trip_size Integer (default: 100) max_table_size Integer (default: 100) max_matching_size Integer (default: 100) max_nearest_size Integer (default: 100) max_alternatives Integer (default: 3) max_matching_radius Integer; use -1 unlimited (default: -1) echo_cmd logical. Print command running; default FALSE.

title: Start an OSRM MLD/CH server with osrm-routed — osrm_start_server
text: processx::process object running server

what: Stop an OSRM server started with osrm_start_server — osrm_stop_server
title: Stop an OSRM server started with osrm_start_server — osrm_stop_server
text: Terminates osrm-routed process launched osrm_start_server().

title: Stop an OSRM server started with osrm_start_server — osrm_stop_server
code: osrm_stop_server(server)

title: Stop an OSRM server started with osrm_start_server — osrm_stop_server
text: server processx::process object returned osrm_start_server().

title: Stop an OSRM server started with osrm_start_server — osrm_stop_server
text: Invisibly returns processx::process object (now stopped).

title: Uninstall OSRM Backend Binaries — osrm_uninstall
text: Removes OSRM backend binaries optionally clears PATH configuration project's .Rprofile.

title: Uninstall OSRM Backend Binaries — osrm_uninstall
code: osrm_uninstall(dest_dir = NULL, clear_path = TRUE, quiet = FALSE)

title: Uninstall OSRM Backend Binaries — osrm_uninstall
text: dest_dir string specifying directory remove OSRM binaries. NULL (default), default user cache directory used. clear_path logical value. TRUE (default), also removes PATH configuration project's .Rprofile calling osrm_clear_path(). quiet logical value. TRUE, suppresses confirmation prompts. Defaults FALSE.

title: Uninstall OSRM Backend Binaries — osrm_uninstall
text: Invisibly returns TRUE directory successfully removed, FALSE otherwise.

title: Uninstall OSRM Backend Binaries — osrm_uninstall
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Uninstall OSRM and clear .Rprofile (will ask for confirmation) osrm_uninstall()  # Only uninstall binaries, leave .Rprofile untouched osrm_uninstall(clear_path = FALSE) } # }
